intro: Ptilotus crinitus, commonly known as the silky bush or silky centipede plant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Ptilotus crinitus is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
